bug.short_desc: Performance enhancements on DocumentUtil.

long_desc.thetext:
Currently, DocumentUtil uses clone() mechanism to serialize the flattern report design. And this class has no performance tuning. Propose several enhancements for it:
1. if the design doesn't include libraries, do not use clone() method. 2. uses the visitor pattern to flat element references.
After above changes, will see whether further improvements can be made.

Current DocumentUtil used three phases to write out the document. 1. clone the design to get the new design; 2. localize required elements to new design; 3. serialize out the new design.
The phase 1 and 2 can be combined into one. And the call to clone() is not necessary. After this enhancement: 1. visit nodes on the design to create new design 2.serialize the new design. Another enhancement is that if the design has no libraries, directly serialize the design file.

bug.short_desc: The construction of row&dataSetRow&params expressions.

long_desc.thetext:
The construction of row&dataSetRow&params expressions are now litter around the BIRT components including Data, GUI, Chart etc. Most of them cannot correctly create the expressions with unusually column/parameter name.
DtE has provided a utility class in core "ExpressionUtil" to handle the creation of expression. All above components should call methods in that class to create expressions.
Can this be safely changed in 2.1.1 code base to avoid potential bugs with expression creation? schedule to 2.2.0 for now, if it is safe to check in to 2.1.1 please change it to 2.1.1.

Whether these code can be safely changed depends on the number of hardcoded row&dataSetRow&params expressions that are used in each project. This kind of hard coding is not very popular in DtE so we can do safe change. But this is a crossteam issue so we still need feedbacks from other team to see if this can be done in 2.1.1.
DtE part of this bug has been fixed.

On GUI codes, row/dataSetRow/params expressions' construction are mostly implemented by invoke the methods:getExpression, getColumnExpression, getResultSetColumnExpression in DEUtil. Modified to use the method provided in core "ExpressionUtil" in above methods.
In "ExpressionValueCellEditor.java", changed to use "ExpressionUtil.createJSParameterExpression" directly.
Fixed the GUI part of this bug.
Reassign it to Chart to continute investigation.
Delegated ChartUIUtil method to the one provided by core plug-in. Transfer to engine team

Engine has already use createJSRowExpression & createJSParameterExpression.
There is another place needs to change to use createJSRowExpression: org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.impl.getColumnRefExpression( String expr )
The bug is fixed.

bug.short_desc: NPE when invoking Apply Patch

long_desc.thetext:
When performing "Team > Apply Patch..." on a resource in a custom filesystem, I get a NullPointerException.
The reason behind this problem can be found in org.eclipse.compare.internal.patch.InputPatchPage#adjustToCurrentTarget():718, where the location of the patch target is retrieved. For resources that do not reside on the local filesystem, the methods IResource#getLocation() and IResource#getRawLocation() return null (IResource#getLocationURI() should be used instead). The NPE that occurs at this point is catched and silently ignored. The NPE I get is generated in the org.eclipse.compare.internal.patch.InputPatchPage#isPatchFile(Reader) predicate (the BufferedReader constructor), because it does not take into account the possibility that the given reader might be null.
Partial stacktrace:
java.lang.NullPointerException at java.io.Reader.<init>(Reader.java:61) at java.io.BufferedReader.<init>(BufferedReader.java:76) at java.io.BufferedReader.<init>(BufferedReader.java:91) at org.eclipse.compare.internal.patch.InputPatchPage.isPatchFile(InputPatchPage.java:779) at org.eclipse.compare.internal.patch.InputPatchPage.adjustToCurrentTarget(InputPatchPage.java:725) at org.eclipse.compare.internal.patch.InputPatchPage.createControl(InputPatchPage.java:163) at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.Wizard.createPageControls(Wizard.java:180) at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.createPageControls(WizardDialog.java:614) at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.createContents(WizardDialog.java:502) at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.create(Window.java:426) at org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.Dialog.create(Dialog.java:1124) at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:785) at org.eclipse.compare.internal.patch.CompareWithPatchAction.run(CompareWithPatchAction.java:86) at org.eclipse.compare.internal.BaseCompareAction.run(BaseCompareAction.java:26) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PluginAction.runWithEvent(PluginAction.java:254) at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.handleWidgetSelection(ActionContributionItem.java:539) at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.access$2(ActionContributionItem.java:488) at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem$5.handleEvent(ActionContributionItem.java:400) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)
Fix released to HEAD.
Verified in I20060919-0010

bug.short_desc: Do not invalidate changed objects

long_desc.thetext: If an object is changed in a local transaction, it must not be touched by invalidation notifications.

Invalidations that arrive for objects that have been changed in the ongoing local ransaction are now deferred until the local transaction is committed (and subsequently rolled back). These deferred invalidations are used on rollback to enable proper reloading. New functionality is covered in http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/org.eclipse.emft/cdo/tests/org.eclipse.emf.cdo.tests/src/org/eclipse/emf/cdo/tests/model1/RollbackTest.java?rev=HEAD&cvsroot=Technology_Project&content-type=text/vnd.viewcvs-markup
Committed to CVS

bug.short_desc: GC.drawPolyline(...) very slow if line width > 0 - was: Squiggles and margin painter slow on long lines

long_desc.thetext:
The squiggles drawing strategy together with enabled margin painter degrades drawing performance for long lines.
To reproduce: - change drawing strategy of bookmarks to squiggles - create a simple text file with a long line (~ 4000 characters) - enable the print margin painter - create a bookmark on the long line - observe sluggish drawing (and very high CPU usage)
Interestingly, enabling the margin painter after creating the bookmark does not degrade performance.
http://www.eclipse.org/eclipse/platform-text/development/bug-incomplete.htm

Created an attachment (id=48953) Test project
Steps to reproduce: - import test project into a workspace using plain Eclipse SDK - import preferences file "preferences.epf" contained in the project - open file "longline.txt" with default Eclipse Text Editor - create a bookmark on line 4 - type text into line 4
Created an attachment (id=48955) Thread dumps while busy drawing
I did not test other platforms, but it definitely happens on - Windows XP SP 1 - Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (1.5.0_06-b05 mixed mode) - Eclipse SDK 3.2 (Build id: M20060629-1905)

Can reproduce now.
The problem is that normally the GC's line width is 0 which means "use fastest possible algorithm". The MarginPainter sets this to 1 since it wants to have 1 pixel width guaranteed. Using 1 seems to bring the performance of drawPolyline(...) down to the knees. If e.g. 5 is used it is even worse.
We now explicitly set the GC's line with to 0 when drawing the squiggles.
Moving to SWT to investigate the performance problem.

If you want to draw the fastest possible line, you should use line width zero. On X (and some other graphics systems), this tells the graphics subsystem to optimize the line drawing as much as possible, making use of any special drivers. However, the output might not be identical to the same line drawn with line width one (but both lines will be one pixel wide).
Having said all that, we still might have a performance problem here.

>If you want to draw the fastest possible line, you should use line width zero. Yep, that's what we now ensure to be used for the squiggles painter but the print margin painter has API to set the width.
>However, the output might not be identical to the same line drawn >with line width one (but both lines will be one pixel wide). So, they will both we 1 but how would they differ then? Does it mean that width 0 can override the line style then?

No it means that on X for example, the actual pixels that are drawn may vary. When the width is one, X uses "slow code" that follows a well know algorithm, making sure the pixels are the same between two different X platforms. When the width is zero, X is free to use "optimized code" in the driver.
I'm a bit surprised that Windows does this sort of thing too and suspect our code. That's why I didn't close this bug report.

There is nothing that SWT can do about this. If a PS_GEOMETRIC pen needs to be used, it will be alot slower than a PS_COSMETIC pen. PS_COSMETIC can be used with line widths other than 0, but the following properties have true as well:
cap=SWT.CAP_ROUND join=SWT.JOIN_ROUND dashes=null style=SWT.LINE_SOLID

According to your explanation this is then either WONTFIX or INVALID since I just explained that you also see the degradation. WORKSFORME indicates that you could not reproduce what got reported.
Maybe a hint in Javadoc that even using 1 pixel instead of fastest can have this non-minor performance impact?
I guess I was trying to say WORKASEXPECTED. The note is already in the javadoc for setLineWidth().
closing again.

bug.short_desc: New behavior to create column binding names.

long_desc.thetext:
The rule is that: if a content element defines data set or column bindings, to refer bindings on container, it must use syntax like row._outer.
So, ONLY check the data binding to which the new column is being added. That is, binding names can be same for content and container elements.
For example, if the column binding is added to the data, only check column bindings on data. Do not need to concern column bindings on its container like table item.
Make sure other teams know this change.
*** Bug 156085 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
fix it
Verified in build 0917.

bug.short_desc: Add support for org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.Dialog

long_desc.thetext:
What do I mean by that: - add new style "Dialog" under "RCP" category in "New Java Visual Class" wizard, or better, add a new category "JFace", - when selected created class should extend org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.Dialog, - once accepted, editor should display dialog trimmings in the similar way, "View" style shows view trimmings, - generated code should go into createDialogArea method in the similar way it goes into createPartControl method in case of a view.
Other ideas: - shell properties (style, text) should be editable directly from the "Properties" view - this would generate code into configureShell method and getShellStyle method, - an easy way to select dialog buttons should be available - this would generate code into createButtonsForButtonBar method.
Same approach could possibly be used to add support for ApplicationWindow (both classes extend Window).

bug.short_desc: The window with SWT.NO_TRIM and Region has invalid dot in top right and left bottom corners

IMHO it's obvious that if user wants to move private variable to another class it either has to be made static with adjusted visibility (if no target class instance is available in context) or member variable with adjusted visibility (if target class instance is available in context). Are there any other possibilities? Please note that I'm not sure if the latter is automatically doable; maybe it always has to be static.

Move static fields is a refactoring. Move instance fields just a textual move. I agree that this is a bit confusing, it would be good if the dialog indicates this better.
I son't think it is possible to offer a refactoring 'instance to static fields'.
We'll have a look at all moves in 3.3, there are several open gaps there.

bug.short_desc: JSP fragment without HTML Doctype: validation fails for <A name=.../>

long_desc.thetext: Validation of a named HTML anchor () fails in a JSP fragment. First of all a the file where validation works (yes, the HTML header is missing ;-) ): ========================= <%@page pageEncoding="Cp1252" contentType="text/html; charset=UTF8"%> www.google.de ========================= Now I take a JSP fragment without a Doctype declaration: ========================= <%@page pageEncoding="Cp1252" contentType="text/html; charset=UTF8"%> www.google.de ========================= The second "a" element is underlined yellow, and the error message is "Invalid location of tag (a)". I will attach a screenshot of the error message. If I convert the first anchor to "" validation works again. Well, I cannot declare a DOCTYPE, so I went into the preferences (for the affected file, and also for the whole project) and in "Web Content Settings" I choose "HTML 4.01 Transitional" for the "Document type" setting. This is how ".settings\org.eclipse.wst.html.core.prefs" looks like ("JspWithoutDocType.jsp" is the file which contains the incorrectly validated sample): =========================== #Tue Aug 29 12:39:59 CEST 2006 document-type//WebContent/JspWithoutDocType.jsp=-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN document-type/=-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN eclipse.preferences.version=1 =========================== Is this settings not applied to the fragment ?

Created an attachment (id=48952) Screenshot of the JSP editor showing the error messages
The error popup to the right was pasted from a second screenshot.

The Web Content Settings is applied to fragments as well. However currently, the html validator does not treat jsp fragments any differently than regular html files. So this means if you are missing the tags that should be surrounding the anchor tag, like html, body, you will get warnings.
I'm not sure if/when we will create a special type of html validator for jsp fragments, but we do have another bug open to just turn off html validation on jsp fragments: bug 149279. You might want to cc yourself to that bug.

Hi Amy, In difference to bug 149279 my JSP fragment file contains a block of clean HTML, so I WANT to validate it, and validation works perfectly fine. Excluding it from validation would be the wrong approach here. Really strange is that "" causes a warning for the following "" tag, while "" does not. So it seems that this is a validation problem. Shouldn't validation actually complain about the missing "..."-tags (as you wrote in commenct 2) ? Might this be another problem/bug ? From my point of view the validator should "inject" the HTML header (with the doctype specified in the project's web content settings) before validation if none is found. So my second sample should look like this after the "injection" and before validation is performed: <%@page pageEncoding="Cp1252" contentType="text/html; charset=UTF8"%> www.google.de

Created an attachment (id=49038) Import this file to see the three JSP fragments described in the bug
"JspWithoutDocType.jsp" shows an error, the two other JSPs are fine.

attachment.desc: Screenshot of the JSP editor showing the error messages
Import this file to see the three JSP fragments described in the bug

bug.short_desc: Screen components dissappear on keyboard navigation

long_desc.thetext:
Test setup: - 1. WindowsXP SP2. 2. Change the theme in the Windows 'Display Properties' to 'Windows Classic'.
Steps to reproduce the defect: - 1. Run the attached sample SWT application. 2. Notice that the cursor is at the first text box, by default. Now use the Tab key to navigate to the next screen component. 3. DEFECT: Observe that the radio buttons in the app screen dissapear.
NOTE #1: The defect is seen only on WindowsXP while it is set to 'Windows Classic' theme. NOTE #2: The problem occurs on usage of the setBackground method <<button.setBackground(composite.getBackground())>>. The defect is not seen if this method isn't used.

Please reopen if not a duplicate. Some people are seeing this problem but not everybody. Strange.

bug.short_desc: [performance] Huge performance difference between 'step over' and 'resume'

long_desc.thetext:
I have an application that I am debugging, normally by stepping through it line by line. One of the lines calls an initialisation function that loads some files, initialises arrays etc. When I use 'step over' to step over this line, it takes many minutes, so many that I actually have to stop the debugger. But when instead I place a breakpoint after this line and press 'resume', the time taken is pretty reasonable (5 seconds or so).
I am using Sun's jdk1.5.0_08.
We'll need a sample program to investigate the behavior.
Marking as remind. We need more information.
Reopening to close
Sample program requested 9 months ago, no response. No indication that this is a significant performance issue. Marking as INVALID.

bug.short_desc: [Plan Item] Static Profile Definition

long_desc.thetext:
The current support for profiles in UML2 makes use of dynamic EMF, which essentially means that the (de)serialization algorithm for data types must be already known to EMF. The use of data types for stereotype properties types is then impossible.
Providing a mechanism whereby a profile developer could specify that the profile metadata be static, e.g. they could use EMF to generate an implementation and fill in any of the missing details such as data type (de)serialization. The use of data types as stereotype properties types will be possible.

I believe this can be accomplished with the existing code.
In your profile, create a PrimitiveType call it MyPrimitiveType. Stereotype your primitive type with the EDataType stereotype from Ecore profile. Set the Instance Class Name to "java.lang.String" or whatever. Create a Stereotype. Create a property typed by MyPrimitiveType. Define your profile. You can also use "java.lang.Object" if you want to add arbitrary objects.
Is this not enough or did you want something more?

I have to deal with DataTypes that have properties. The use of primitiveTypes is not sufficient. Furthermore, I want to make UML users specifiy their own dataTypes or use in their profile dataTypes that have been specified in external model libraries.
Unfortunately the use of primitiveTypes stereotyped EDataType does not correspond to our needs.

You can still UML Data type in a similar way. (Note: UML primitive types correspond to EDataTypes in ecore but you are not forced to use primitive types).
Create a uml data type and specify your properties. Stereotype your UML data type with <<eClass>>. Fill in the Instance Class Name of the newly created data type.
If your data type is specified in an external library, when you define your profile, an EClass will be created in the ecore representation of your profile if an existing definition cannot be found in the EPackage registry.
Created an attachment (id=60376) fix minor issues
Further profile enhancements will be made to ... https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=163556

(In reply to comment #3)
eClass stereotype does not extend UML DataType in my version of UML2 (2.0.3). In which version we can apply eClass stereotype to DataType?
It was changed in 2.1 around 11/30/2006 in a fix for 150154.

(In reply to comment #7)
I have tried what you said with version 2.1M5 and I had two errors of validation after profile definition:
- The required feature 'eAttributeType' of 'myProp : MyDataType' must be set - The generic attribute type must not refer to a class
'myProp' is the property of my stereotype. 'myprop' is typed MyDataType which is stereotyped <<eClass>>.
Created an attachment (id=60438) update

The updated patch addresses your problem please try it. I believe I didn't see that problem since I was using slightly different options and got different results from the define().
Rember to set the ClassName of the DataType in addition to the Instance Class Name. You can also experiment with setting the XML Content Kind to Simple.
In addition, for the property that is typed by the data type you might need to apply the <<eAttribute>> stereotype and set its XML Feature Kind to simple aswell.
Have a look at bugzilla 150154 for more details.
I will continue to experiment with the various options but let me know if that solves your issue.

Thank you for your patch. I have succeeded in applying my profile but it is impossible to edit the tag value typed by MyDataType. I have specified it as a java.lang.String instance. Is this just a problem of uml2 editor?
This can solve my issue if I can do all these steps programmatically. Do you see any possible problems in doing this programmatically?
It seems to work even if I do not stereotype MyDataType <<eClass>>. But I still have the value edition problem when the stereotype is applied.

James,
Are you planning to commit these changes? It would be nice if DataTypes are automatically handled like PrimitiveTypes (with instance class name = java.lang.String by default).
Chokri

Chokri,
There are some additional changes that I think will be required for this to work properly.
If I understand correctly, you want to be able to generate code from your profile ( ie. create an .ecore representation with genmodel etc ). Then, when you define your profile, you want to be able to reference that .ecore representation. For that to work we need to add a new data source to the EMF wizard to accept profiles and use the customized Profile2Ecore converter. Also, the define needs to be able to reference the existing .ecore representation. The apply needs to know how to deal with that new format of defined profile.
Once the entire solution is complete it will be delivered at one time.
- James
Created an attachment (id=60667) update

I've attached another update which preserves legacy API and handles properties typed by template parameters. So far, the patch will use classifiers from registered Ecore packages, so it should be possible, for example, to develop an EMF-based implementation of a type library and use it in a profile.
Note that a UML data type will always be converted to an Ecore class (i.e. a complex type); if you want an Ecore data type (i.e. a simple type), you'll need to use a UML primitive type.
I have some trouble in applying the last update. On which version of UMLUtil should I apply it?

This would be a good solution. By the way, for users who do not want to generate an ecore model from DataTypes and reference it in the profile definition, an intermediate solution would be to handle UML DataTypes like UML PrimitiveTypes.
A DataType instance is identified by its value in UML. This value could be a simple string that conforms to a given grammar. It would be great to have this behavior by default, I mean being able to valuate applied stereotype dataType properties with a string (just like primitive types are currently handled in uml2 editor).
You were very close to that solution in your 2007-03-08 12:09 patch.
The latest patch is based on the latest bits in CVS - please ensure you have synchronized with HEAD before trying to apply it.

Kenn,
I did not found the latest version in dev.eclipse.org:/cvsroot/tools/... What is the repository location please?
Chokri
Ok I have found them in dev.eclipse.org:/cvsroot/modeling
Created an attachment (id=60692) UMLUtil.java.rej
Even after synchronizing with HEAD I sill have some errors in applying the patch.
I have thought about my issue and having dataTypes handled like primitiveTypes will just be fine for me. I just want to edit their values as a String.

The correct CVS location is dev.eclipse.org:/cvsroot/tools/org.eclipse.uml2/plugins/org.eclipse.uml2.uml.
I'm not sure that I understand what you mean by "having dataTypes handled like primitiveTypes"... As previously stated, UML data types are treated as complex types (i.e. classes) when converted to Ecore... are you asking for that to be changed?

Thanks for the location. James told me to use uml 2.1 that's why I was looking for other sources.
If it is possible to change the treatment of dataTypes as simple types yes it would be an answer for my issue.
I have to deal with valuation of stereotype properties of type DataType. In fact, I have a grammar specifying the way to instantiate my DataTypes. So if the dataTypes are treated like a string, I would just have to enter a string that conforms to my grammar to have my dataType instantiated.

Sorry for the numerous requests I am asking for this issue and thank you for your cooperation.
If it is not possible to have DataTypes treated as simple types it is not a problem because this is feasible by modifying the profile definition.
If you think that the initially planned solution (i.e. to treat them as an EClass and extend profile definition and application mechanisms to handle them) is a more permanent solution, then please proceed to these changes.
Thanks,
Chokri

Created an attachment (id=61739) support static profile defn
Kenn, Please have a look at this patch. I boiled out the minimum set of changes to support defining profile, then if in EPackageRegistry, we can apply stereotype without explcitly defining profile. Issue: The UMLUtil#getProfile() cannot directly get its hands on the resource set from the context object. Issue: For profile operations getDefinition(), should we introduce switch to look like UMLUtil#getNamedElement

Created an attachment (id=61994) merged patch.
some TODO's remain..
The changes have been committed to CVS. Details of how to develop statically defined profiles will be provided in a forthcoming article.
The changes are available in build I200703301423.

bug.short_desc: download.php should detect if the file is on archive.eclipse.org instead of download

long_desc.thetext:
Build teams use download.php?file=/toplevel/project/file.zip to use the mirrors.
When builds are archived to http://archive.eclipse.org, the teams need to update all the links on the page to point directly to the new site. Some projects forget, resulting in 404's and e-mails to webmaster.
download.php already pokes the filesystem to make sure the file= parameter is sane. If the file is not found on download.eclipse.org (which is an exception), it should look in archive.eclipse.org. If the file is there, the browser should then receive a 302 Redirect to the http://archive.eclipse.org file.
D.
This has been fixed. If a file is invalid for download.eclipse.org, it looks on archive.eclipse.org before failing. If the file is on archive, the download begins from that point.
Moving to Community/Website

bug.short_desc: Workspace Search (Replace...) only checks out (N/2)+1 files

long_desc.thetext:
eclipse 3.2.0 Rational clearcase SCM adapter 6.0.49 CDT 3.1.0
Search -> Search... -> Replace...
Correctly finds all the files but the Replace... operation only checks out (N/2)+1 files from source control (ClearCase). The replace operates on the checked-out files but the user is presented with "<file> is read only" for those it did not check out.
If the Search... -> Replace... operation is performed again it finds all the files that the previous "Replace.." didn't checkout, but again only checks out (N/2)+1 of the remaining files from source control.
In my case the there is one file in one of 15 projects in the workspace. To run the operation on a search revealing these 15 files takes four attempts, as at first 8 files are checked out, then 4, then 2 then (fianlly) the last file.
this should be fixed by the fix for bug 49114.

long_desc.thetext: I tried to maximize a view by double clicking on its tab. Everything else minimized as expected but the view only maximiized horizontally. I was maximizing the Projects view in the Java Browsing perspective.
This is because I need to not only set the editorArea to visible I have to amnipulate the state bits to cause it to be removes from the layout calcs...
Fixed now...the creation of a 'special' stack for the editor area is being tracked in the main defect...

bug.short_desc: Problems with CopyingResource

long_desc.thetext:
The org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.emf.core.clipboard.CopyingResource class has the following problems:
1. The getHREF(EObject) method assigns eObj to null after testing that it is null (!) and calls eObj.eResource() twice unnecessarily.
2. The getHREF(Resource, EObject) method appends an invalid fragment query (it is missing the trailing separator), and only does so when the referenced resource is and instance of GMFResource (this won't be the case for any of the copied resources!)... why is this even being done, given that GMFResource doesn't do it?
3. The getEObject(String) method (also in GMFResource) is incorrect (it assumes a bogus fragment query) and inefficient - it is also unnecessary since handling of fragment queries is already done by the parent class.
The following improvements should also be made:
1. References to "msl" terminology should be removed (where possible).
2. XML helper and save implementations should be refactored into nested classes to that they can be more easily extended and customized.
3. Fields and query methods (like getResourcesMap(), isInResource(EObject)) should be made protected so that they can be called by subclasses.

Problems:
1. Please also cache the resource in a variable the first time it is obtained - calls to eResource() can actually be relatively expensive...
2. OK... but I wonder whether the fragment queries should be appended at all given that the GMF resource implementation does not.
3. Agreed.
Improvements:
1. OK. Note that the mslCopyingResourceSet instance variable is redundant since ResourceImpl already has a resourceSet instance variable.
2. Thanks.
3. Access to at least the xmlResource field is needed by subclasses that must use a different save or helper implementation but want to retain (duplicate) the behavior provided in the copying resource.

In reference to comment 2:
Problems:
1. Will do.
2. You're right, but unfortunately we still need to append the fragment query to support historical resources. If we remove the code, clients that work with such historical resources will have to subclass and override to add the support they need for themselves. We can clean this up in 2.0.
Improvements:
1. Possibly true. I'm reluctant to risk changing the implementation just to save on one possibly redundant field. If we set the resourceSet in ResourceImpl, the behaviour of the class changes since the superclass implementations work with the resourceSet field directly rather than using the #getResourceSet method. Currently we never set this field. I'd want to wait until we have a real problem with this implementation before changing it.
3. Will add access to the xmlResource field.
Opened bug 156614 to track the suggested improvements that will be deferred to 2.0 because they require API change, or they will force changes in existing client code.
Fixed as discussed.

bug.short_desc: [Help] Text on Links page requires some rewording

long_desc.thetext:
The links page in the help system currently has the following text:
In the workbench, you can get context-sensitive help (called infopops) for a widget by putting focus on it and pressing F1. If you click one of the infopop's links, it will bring you here, and show you all the links to related topics. <end>
This needs to be edited to something like this (which is horrible, I admit):
In the workbench, you can get context-sensitive help for a widget by putting focus on it and pressing F1. If you choose to display context-sensitive help in infopops (see the Help Preferences page), then if you click one of the infopop's links, it will bring you here, and show you all the links to related topics. <end>
For 3.3 (or later) we should probably think about whether we still need this page. It's only used if the user selects Infopops rather than Dynamic Help. Not sure having its own tab in the help system is really justified anymore. Or maybe it should only be displayed if that Preference is set to infopops?

bug.short_desc: [Browser] API to support WTP's browser usage

long_desc.thetext:
When the internal browser support was moved down from WTP to the platform, one piece of function (quick menu to change the current browser) was not accepted as platform function or API that should be exposed at the time. Since the function remained in WTP, there are 8 references to internal classes in WTP (see report below).
This bug is opened to track cleaning up this internal usage, either through the platform picking up this function, exposing additional API, or other means. A corresponding bug 97255 is open against WTP, and I'm available to help with implementation once we decide which way to go.
WTP build API report:
org.eclipse.wst.server.ui.internal.webbrowser.SwitchBrowserWorkbenchAction
Cannot reference: org.eclipse.ui.internal.browser.BrowserManager getInstance(...) 99 100 getCurrentWebBrowser(...) 99 getWebBrowsers(...) 101 org.eclipse.ui.internal.browser.IBrowserDescriptor org.eclipse.ui.internal.browser.WebBrowserPreference getBrowserChoice(...) 97 104 org.eclipse.ui.internal.browser.WebBrowserUtil canUseInternalWebBrowser(...) 96
org.eclipse.wst.server.ui.internal.webbrowser.SwitchDefaultBrowserAction
Cannot reference: org.eclipse.ui.internal.browser.BrowserManager setCurrentWebBrowser(...) 54 org.eclipse.ui.internal.browser.IBrowserDescriptor getName(...) 40 org.eclipse.ui.internal.browser.WebBrowserPreference setBrowserChoice(...) 51 53
Could you elaborate a little on what the function is for?

The function adds a menu item to the Windows menu that has a submenu listing all of the available Web browsers. The user can see which browser is currently being used and select a different one. This is handy primarily for web developers who want to test their code on multiple browsers - they can easily toggle between browsers by using keystrokes or menu item instead of going to the preference page.
If you want to see the code (it's very simple), you can find the org.eclipse.wst.server.ui classes listed above in the WTP SDK.

bug.short_desc: shift + tab with space indent

long_desc.thetext: shift + tab with space indent delete only one space instead indentation size

It's unable to detect from the context either it's needed to remove several tabs or just 1 - indentation size for Tab is applicable only if cursor is placed *before* indentation suggestion position, but not defined where. Shift+Tab action should be an opposite of a regular tab, not so called 'smart tab', which actually indents a line.
Closed as Invalid.

bug.short_desc: Import of tasklist doesn't allow cancel of operation

long_desc.thetext: If "OVERWRITE existing files.." is not selected when importing, for each destination file that exists a dialog is presented to the user asking if they would like to overwrite the file or not. This should be replaced by a single dialog which lists the files to be overwritten and gives the option to cancel the entire operation.

Gails comments from bug#155469: It was cancelling out on overridding. I was trying to get back my task list and tried an import with no auto-overriding. It started asking me about a ton of file and there was no way to cancel out of the entire operation. (If we continue this thread, it should be a new bug report)
Deferring.

no problem. closing bug as invalid.

bug.short_desc: Declaration.getPosition broken for keys.

long_desc.thetext:
The entity returned by getKey() is a AnnotationTypeElementDeclaration; you'll notice that extends MethodDeclaration. It describes the declaration of the key method in the annotation.
That is, it's pointing to the declaration of the what() method within DemoAnnotation, not to the reference in the annotation in DemoAnnoTest. This matches the behavior of Sun's apt tool.
So, how do you get to what you want, which is the source position of the reference to what within the annotation instance? Good question! I just hunted around and I couldn't find any way to do it either, in the Sun API. You can get the source position of the AnnotationMirror, but not of keys within it. If you need that level of resolution you may be forced to use the JDT DOM AST, rather than the APT typesystem; unfortunately that would make your code Eclipse-specific.

It seems very odd to be able to get source positions for the values of key-value pairs but not the keys. Is it worth checking with Sun to see if this the intended behaviour or a case of bug for bug compatibility?
Cheers, James.

I agree with your sentiment. But it wouldn't be the first odd thing about the com.sun.mirror API, nor about the way annotations themselves are implemented in Java.
The AnnotationTypeElementDeclaration pretty much has to point to the declaration of the annotation method. After all, you need some way of getting at that, and some way of representing it. So "fixing" the return value of getPosition() on that is not the right answer, I think. In other words, I think that the Sun behavior is not a coding bug, I think it's a problem with the design of the API.
Rather, I think the fix would need to be along the lines of introducing an additional wrapper type, analogous to AnnotationValue. That is, instead of getKey() returning an AnnotationTypeElementDeclaration, it would return an AnnotationKey, which would implement methods like getPosition() and getElementDeclaration(). The former would report the position of the key in the annotation instance; the latter would return the AnnotationTypeElementDeclaration if needed.
But since JSR269 is replacing com.sun.mirror, I don't believe Sun would be receptive to enhancing com.sun.mirror; and JSR269 itself is essentially closed at this point, since it is shipping in Mustang (Java 6). There are some substantial warts on JSR269 as well, and it will be interesting to see whether it will need to be enhanced or replaced in the future.
I wish this were something that we had any ability to fix! Regrettably, that's the nature of public APIs. We could provide an Eclipse-specific override that added the method you want, but then you'd be back to having Eclipse-specific code, at which point you might as well be working with the JDT DOM AST anyway.
Ok, many thanks for your feedback. I'll pursue the JDT DOM AST approach.

bug.short_desc: Stale ... Search again .. hangs eclipse

long_desc.thetext: Eclipse 3.2 hangs on a search-replace operation if the users says "yes" (or ok?) to searach again when the "..stale..." dialog comes up. A window pops up saying "Operation in progress...", the green bar is full, but nothing happens. "Cancel" clicks and goes grey but nothing happens. The only thing I can do is kill the process. Sorry this isn't much information, but its what I have.

Do you have this reproducable? I couldn't.

bug.short_desc: [DOC] Ant Builder has no "Run the builder" settings

long_desc.thetext:
To reproduce problem:
Select a project the select properties / builders / New Builder / Ant builder then switch to Build Options tab. There is no "Run the builder" group where the activation event for the builder could be specified.
Despite the documentation (Eclipse 3.2) "Creating a project builder Ant buildfile" even has a screen capture that has the "Run the builder" group.
Version: 3.2.0 Build id: M20060629-1905
Ant builder is rather unusable without those build options.

Thank you for the bug report. The documentation is out of date with the implementation.
Please see the Targets tab to configure the activation event and set the targets to execute on the event.
qs-93_project_builder.htm updated and deleted Image610_et_options_tab.png and added Image610_et_targets_tab.png
Please verify Michael.
verified
build notes updated

Software Environment: Windows XP

Steps to Reproduce: 1. In the LTA-Eclipse version, go to "File->New->Profiling and Logging->Symptom Database 2. Type in all required fields and add a description to the catalog 3. Double-click the new catalog in the "Log Navigator View" 4. Go the "Details" portion of the symptom catalog editor 5. Start typing in a long description, when the text exceeds the window width, the text starts to scroll to the right and you can no longer see what you've typed all in the same text field. 6. I know I can press "Enter" but that entails in a truncated description when I resize windows or load the symptom catalog in other tools (it is a standard format afterall)

bug.short_desc: [web services] WebServicesManager is not binary module aware

long_desc.thetext:
The WebServicesManager is hardcoded to using J2EE projects and artifact edits and the web service artifact edits have not been ported to be able to use binary j2ee modules. This will limit the user from being able to add service references to web services defined in binary modules.
I'm not sure we can or should contain this for 1.5.1.

bug.short_desc: Server.canStop() implementation

long_desc.thetext:
org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server
Currently, the canStop returns OK if the server is not stopped. I think it should also check if launchConfigId and launchModes are defined. If they arent defined, then it means the server cant be started, so it shouldnt be stopped.
My issue is I have a server that doesnt support start, stop and restart. Because of the current implementation, the Stop in the (context) menu is always enabled, which doesnt make sense.
My ref number. 355614
We also need to support servers that can stop even though there is no way to start them, e.g. remote servers connected via JMX. Angel - Can you see if there is any simple way to fix this?

As a suggestion, you could make a requirement (or an optional way) where delegates can provide their own canStop() implementation so that any server adapter can state when their server can be stopped. If you make it optional, then the canStop() implementation that exists now could stay the way it is but a delegates implementation would take precedence.

Looking at the code, for 1.5.1 at the bare minimun we can probably do the check to see if launchConfigId and launchModes are defined.
In order to provide a a full solution as suggested by Troy, we would need to look beyond 1.5.1. So possible 2.0

bug.short_desc: existing Logic Diagram editor Reference is not used

long_desc.thetext:
Steps to reproduce: - Open two editors at the same time: Java editor and Logic Diagram editor - Make sure Java editor is the active one - Close and re-start Eclipse - Double-click on the Logic Diagram file in the Package Explorer or Project explorer. Result: Existing Logic Diagram editor tab is not used, but a new Editor opens instead.
The problem seems to be caused by DiagramDocumentEditorMatchingStrategy line 46. Null gets returned from editorRef.getEditor() call for editor Reference that has never been restored and a potential match gets missed.

Created an attachment (id=49505) Patch
DiagramDocumentEditorMatchingStrategy #matches was checking if the given editor was of type DiagramDocumentEditor, and returning false if this was not true, as its matching strategy only applies to DiagramDocumentEditor objects. There is a chance though that the given editor does not yet have a reference when #matches is called, causing this comparison to fail, even if the editor is in fact of type DiagramDocumentEditor.
Now the instanceof check against DiagramDocumentEditor is only preformed if the editor has a reference.
Committed the patch.
Found issues with patch

Created an attachment (id=49757) Patch
Resolves issues in previous patch.

Updated patch to latest version in cvs repository
I did some adhoc testing with multiple diagram types and committed the latest patch.

Get and overview of the features"
and
"Tutorials Tutorials
Go through tutorials"

I'm using PC Linux with JRE 1.5.0_08-b03 and Firefox 1.5.0.6.

http://www.eclipse.org/eclipse/development/readme_eclipse_3.2.html#I-Platform-User-Assistance

Ah well, nevermind then. I must have missed it when I looked in that file. I was probably not using the "Welcome" keyword when I searched it. Hmm. I think I started with a search for "broken" and/or "links". On a related topic, though, shouldn't the "Forms" based implementation actually handle the links in the window?

You're right it should still work with forms, I'm not sure why it didn't. I've tested this many times on linux with 1.5 JRE and 1.5 firefox and haven't seen anything like this.
It's possible (judging from your description) that it wasn't even using forms, but was instead using a broken browser. I say this because the forms page doesn't show a series of links like this, it has a series of images with hover text just like the web implementation, it just looks simpler and not as pretty.
It is possible that a wrong version of the browser was picked up. We revert back to forms when we get an exception during browser creation, which obviously didn't happen in this scenario.

bug.short_desc: Incorrect Modeling Assistant Provider values shouldn't cause exceptions

long_desc.thetext:
To reproduce: - Change the GeoshapeModelingAssistantProvider to return an empty list in the method getRelTypesOnSource(). This is incorrect as the method getRelTypesOnSourceAndTarget() returns a LINE type; however, it is an easy mistake to make so it shouldn't cause problems in the application. - Create a geoshape and a note on the diagram. - Drag the outgoing connection handle from the geoshape to the note. - A popup appears with LINE and NOTE ATTACHMENT. - Choose to create a LINE. RESULT: An error appears in the log and a line is not created.
REASON: The request is initialized when selecting the connection handle from the source shape (the geoshape). However, since LINE is not returned in the getRelTypesOnSource() method no request is initialized.

Purpose: Bugzilla#155584 Incorrect Modeling Assistant Provider values shouldn't cause exceptions - Previously, if the relationship type wasn't specified in the getRelTypesOnSource() or getRelTypesOnTarget() method but was specified in the getRelTypesOnSourceAndTarget() method, it would show up in the relationship list when creating a connection between the appropriate source and target, but when chosen an error would appear in the log and no relationship was created. - I made a slight modification to the code in GraphicalNodeEditPolicy so that the CreateConnectionViewRequest used in this scenario would be added to the map of requests in the CreateUnspecifiedTypeConnectionRequest so that it could be used for enablement checking AND connection creation.
Code Reviewed by: Linda
How tested: Manual Tests: - Created cases where the relationship type wasn't specified in the getRelTypesOnSource() or getRelTypesOnTarget() method and verified that the connection could still be created using the connection handles. - Adhoc connection handle testing.
JUnit Tests: org.eclipse.gmf.tests.runtime.diagram.ui -- all passed
Impact on QE: n/a
Impact on Doc: n/a
Impact on build: n/a
Delivered to Stream(s): dev.eclipse.org:/home/technology (R1_0_maintenance)

bug.short_desc: [Undo] - API - Need interface for computing execution status of an operation

long_desc.thetext:
In bug #123972, we extended IOperationApprover (by introducing IOperationApprover2) to validate the execution of an operation.
The platform UI class AdvancedValidationUserApprover currently implements IOperationApprover, but not IOperationApprover2.
As we implement undoable workspace operations, it is desirable to push the implementation of all validation from the workspace actions to the undoable operations. In order to do this, we need to know that the execution status of these operations will be computed in addition to the undo/redo status.
To do this, we need to: - change AdvancedValidationUserApprover to also implement IOperationApprover2, thus validating the execution of all operations in addition to the undo/redo of those operations. - introduce a new interface, IAdvancedUndoableOperation2, which computes the execution status of an operation before approving it - AdvancedValidationUserApprover would check operations to see if they implement IAdvancedUndoableOperation2, and if so, compute the status as part of approving it.

For example: The RenameResourceAction currently checks for overwrite of a file and queries the user whether overwrite is permitted. We should move this code to the undoable operation for renaming a resource, but need a way to invoke this overwrite check on execute, undo, and redo.
API changes have been released to HEAD. Changes to AdvancedValidationUserApprover are implemented but need more testing before releasing.

Fixed in HEAD, >20060906. Ran the automated undo tests and the manual "integrated undo/redo scenarios" to verify that the preexisting uses of AdvancedValidationUserApprover are not broken by these changes.

verified in I20060919-0010, WinXP. - API's present and verified through source inspection - scenario that calls the code in AdvancedValidationUserApprover can be verified through this scenario: (must have the experimental undo code for rename resource loaded) - copy a resource foo.java to foo2.java - try to rename foo to foo2 - you'll get a warning that the file exists...this warning is coming from the operation approver2.

bug.short_desc: [j2ee] Missing external jar file can't be removed from module dependancies

long_desc.thetext:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new Web project. 2. Open the J2EE Module Dependancies properties page and add an external jar file to the module. 3. Delete the external jar file. (I restarted here, but that's probably not required) 4. Reopen the J2EE Module Dependancies page. The jar is not listed, but it is still in the org.eclipse.wst.common.component file. There are no errors. 5. Make another change (e.g. add/remove another dependancy) and the jar reference mysteriously gets removed.
If a user really wants to clean up the jar file and remove it from the dependancies, they have to edit the component file by hand. If they don't clean it up, then it will appear & disappear from the classpath based on whether the jar happens to be there. Based on the above behaviour I see three bugs here. I'll list them all below and we can split them apart if necessary:
1. If the jar file is missing, it should still be listed (with an error) in the properties page to allow the user to remove it.
2. The user will already get a classpath error if they directly depend on the jar, but if it is being used for other reasons (e.g. property files or jar used by another jar) there should be a validation error to let them know the jar is missing.
3. When modifying the dependancies for another reason, it should not automatically remove 'invalid' entries. If I just happened to move the jar accidentally, I would expect the dependancy to still be there if I move the jar back later.

bug.short_desc: [j2ee properties] J2EE Module Dependencies page initially blank for utility jar

long_desc.thetext:
If you open the properties page for a utility jar module and go to the J2EE Module Dependancies page, it is usually blank (just the title). If you select another page and come back, it now has an error ("Selected module not ..."). If you open the page after it has been used as a utility for a web module, it is always blank.
1. The message should appear the first time you go to the page. (unless you implement 3a below)
2. There should be some information (error? content?) when the jar is being used as a utility for a web module.
3. Instead of an error over top of the title, I think it would be more usable if you either: a) Only make the page visible when a utility jar is being used within the scope of a J2EE application. b) Change the error to a descriptive label within the content body ("This page can only be used...")

bug.short_desc: [performance] Definitions/Types/Import level assertion validation is running more than once per WSDL

long_desc.thetext:
Build: WTP 0824
Definitions/Types/Import level assertion validation is running more than once per WSDL. It is running per Port/Service. Since there's no benefit of running them more than once, we should reduce the # of runs to 1.
This is important, I'll submit a patch. Adding the performace keyword, setting priority to P2 and target to 1.5.1

Created an attachment (id=48996) Patch for wst.wsi
Tested. Ran the WSI JUnit, all passed.
*** Bug 153109 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 154409 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 152786 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Jeff, I looked over the patch and I agree to the fix.
Fix released to HEAD and 1.5.1
verified and close.

bug.short_desc: XML family validators (XSD, WSDL, DTD, XML) do not stop when cancelled

long_desc.thetext: When the XML validators (XSD, WSDL, DTD, XML) are running and the user chooses to cancel them they might not stop quickly enough. This is troublesome for users at best and can block builds at worst. Unlike bug 111831, this bug is concerned about cancelling *while* a file is being processed, not just between validating each file. I've been validating the same WSDL file for over 10 minutes now since pressing the cancel button, and that's just unacceptable.
Created an attachment (id=48998) dialog while trying to save one of the WSDL performance test files
Sounds like this will be tough to fix? Any suggestions?

Not without breaking org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.internal.validation.core.AbstractNestedValidator.validate(String, InputStream, NestedValidatorContext)--the IReporter that can communicate the cancellation is not passed in.

bug.short_desc: Tooltip hover contains duplicate information

long_desc.thetext:
Using the latest hover code from HEAD:
1. Create a new plug-in project On the templates page of the wizard, choose the 'Custom Plug-in Wizard' option. Press Next. Keep all extension points selected. press Finish.
2. Go to the source page. Hover over the 'lightweight' attribute on line 8. The tooltip will contain a messed up description containing duplicates, etc.
There are many other examples, but another good one would be the dups you get by hovering over the 'objectClass' attribute on line 164

Fixed.
Patch applied to HEAD in CVS.
This bug was caused by a fix I made for bug # 154949. It all revolves around the hack I implemented to get around the 0 length Sun Crimson parser SAX characters events bugs. Didn't notice the problem because the description was being truncated.
Removed the hack, ignore 0 length SAX character events altogether and use StringBuffer to properly aggregate the data. Hopefully, this solves the problem once and for all.
Updated the following:
* Schema annotation handler * Schema element handler * Schema attribute handler
thanks Mike.

bug.short_desc: [64] Quoted strings wrapped with strange dotted square in Java editor

long_desc.thetext:
I'm seeing a strange rendering problem in the Java Editor on a gtk based Eclipse 3.2 under x86_64 on Fedora Core 5. On lines that have a string literal, a strange rendering artifact in the form of a dotted square is placed on either side of the string's double quote delimiter and at the beginning and end of the line. The dotted squares do not seem to be actual characters, since they cannot be selected and cursor movement operations jump over them.
This appears to affect only lines of actual java code, since commenting a line out out removes the effect. The affect also appears in the Preferences->Java->Editor->Syntax Coloring preview.
The problem survived upgrading from Eclipse 3.1 to 3.2. I have another very similar PC at home that does not have the problem.
I will attach a screenshot shortly.
Created an attachment (id=48999) PNG file showing the dotted squares around strings
- what font do you use? - how does it render in the Text editor?
BIDI control characters?

My Java editor text font used in the screen shot is Bitstream Vera Sans Mono, Roman style, size 10. Changing it to another font does not alleviate the symptom. For example I tried Console and LucidaTypewriter. Also changing the syntax coloring options (bold, color, underline, etc...) seems to have no effect.
I have only observed this problem in the java editor -- switching to the text editor removes the squares and it renders normally. I also don't see the problem in the Ant or XML editors.
In fact, based on the fact that when you comment a string out that the effect goes away, I'd guess it has something to do specifically with the Java syntax highlighting. Compare line 5 to line 6 in the attachement to see what I'm talking about.
The only other interesting thing is the behavior when you use the arrow keys. If I am left of the square/quotation mark and I hit the right arrow, the cursor will appear on the left of the square. If I hit the right arrow once, it will move to the right of the quote mark (jumping over both at once and never putting the cursor between the square and the quote mark). When I use the left arrow, the cursor does stop between the square and the quote mark. If I hit left again, it jumps over the square and the character to the left.
The difference might be that the Java editor applies/sets style attributes via StyleRange.
I don't see this problem on my Fedora Core 5/i386 or on our old RedHat 9 x86_64. Does it work on a 32bits machine ?

I have two Fedora Core 5 x86_64 boxes and I get the problem on one and not the other. The one with the problem is an SMP box with dual processors. I have never seen the problem on 32 bit architectures, but I can't draw any conclusions.
Can this be bumped up in terms of severity/priority? This bug makes viewing java code seriously annoying in Eclipse.
Since we can't recreate it, we're stuck. Any ideas?
Grant, did you get the new gtk 64 machine ? Could you please try this problem ?
I don't see the problem on 64-bit RHEL4. I don't have FC5 installed.
How to proceed? We need to see something in order to debug or debug remotely by having Bryan try things. Any ideas?

> The problem survived upgrading from Eclipse 3.1 to 3.2.
Does this mean the problem happens in 3.2 but not in 3.1?

> > The problem survived upgrading from Eclipse 3.1 to 3.2. > Does this mean the problem happens in 3.2 but not in 3.1?
The problem exists on 3.1, 3.2, and now 3.2.1. Upgrading did not make it go away.
> Any ideas?
I could try to create a minimal virtual server using VM Ware to demonstrate the problem, maybe. I'd like to try other things first.
I've tried upgrading gtk libraries. What other libraries does gtk eclipse depend on?
Steve speculated about BIDI control characters a while back. What implements and configures bidi? Is it implemented at the gtk level or in eclipse itself? How can I check if I have working bidirectional character support?
One question I have is this: what's different about string highlighting in the java editor vs the xml editor (say)?

The problem has gone away after I upgraded some of the rpms related to gtk on fedora. I can't say which one was responsible, but here's a rough approximation of what I updated: [btaylor@office100-59 opt]$ rpm -qa | grep gtk gtk2-engines-2.7.4-3 gtk2-2.8.20-1 gtk-engines-0.12-7.2.1 gtk+extra-2.1.1-2.fc5 pygtk2-2.8.2-2.1 usermode-gtk-1.85-1 gnome-python2-gtksourceview-2.14.0-1 gtk+-1.2.10-50 gnome-python2-gtkhtml2-2.13.3-3.2 gtk-engines-0.12-7.2.1 gtk2-engines-2.7.4-3 gtkmathview-0.7.6-3.fc5 gtk2-devel-2.8.20-1 pygtk2-libglade-2.8.2-2.1 gtk+-1.2.10-50 gtksourceview-1.6.2-1.fc5 gtkspell-2.0.11-1.2.1 gtk+extra-devel-2.1.1-2.fc5 authconfig-gtk-5.1.2-1 gtk2-2.8.20-1 gtkhtml2-2.6.3-1.2.1 gtk+-devel-1.2.10-50 gtk-qt-engine-0.70-4.20061211svn.fc5.1
You can close this, I guess.
Thanks for getting back to us about this. Marking as WONTFIX (really won't work around) because the operating system fixed it for us.

This works for me. If this is still a problem, please repen with the percise steps you took to cause the problem. It would also be helpful if you captured a trace of the client/server communication using the following URL and attached the error log in case there were errors.
http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/CVS_FAQ#Is_there_any_equivalent_to_CVS_CLIENT_LOG_is_Eclipse.3F

bug.short_desc: INDEX.LIST bypasses x-internal check

long_desc.thetext:
Since at least Java 1.3 developers have been able to include an optional INDEX.LIST file in their META-INF directory to help speed class loading. See: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.3/docs/guide/jar/jar.html#JAR%20Index
When I include an INDEX.LIST file in my plug-in jar file, I am able to reference classes in packages tagged as "x-internal:=true" without any "access discouraged" warnings or errors. It seems the INDEX.LIST file bypasses access checks like the "x-internal:=true" directive in the MANIFEST.MF file. When I remove the INDEX.LIST file, the errors and warnings reappear. Could this be a potential security vulnerability?
Is there a way to include an INDEX.LIST file in a plug-in without it bypassing access checks in the MANIFEST.MF file like "x-internal:=true"?
Please attach sample bundles we can use to reproduce. I cannot see how including an META-INF/INDEX.LIST file in your jar would cause PDE or the framework to treat x-friends differently.
Created an attachment (id=49009) Test bundle
There is something about the plug-in that causes the x-internal tags to be ignored by the IDE despite setting the preference to error. Other SDK jars work fine.

(In reply to comment #3) > There is something about the plug-in that causes the x-internal tags to be > ignored by the IDE despite setting the preference to error. Other SDK jars > work fine. > It looks like the problem was on our side. Our index.list and the Export-Package list were not quite in sync. Thanks.
